tools.name: FastAPI
tools.description: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python based on standard Python type hints.

items: Fast: Very high performance, on par with NodeJS and Go (thanks to Starlette and Pydantic)
Fast to code: Increase the speed to develop features by about 200% to 300%.
Fewer bugs: Reduce about 40% of human (developer) induced errors.
Easy: Designed to be easy to use and learn. Less time reading docs.
Short: Minimize code duplication. Multiple features from each parameter declaration. Fewer bugs.
Standards-based: Based on (and fully compatible with) the open standards for APIs: OpenAPI (previously known as Swagger) and JSON Schema.
useCases.title: Key Features

processes.title: Custom Process 1
processes.description: Adding a custom process to test with.

projects.title: PlateMate
projects.description: Plate-Mate was created for individuals that want to go out , either alone or with a friend, and cannot decide where to eat. Whether they do not know what is around, can't agree on where to go, or there are just too many options, this app will help remedy that.

projects.title: Paw-Wow
projects.description:
Paw Wow has been created for dog-owners who want to socialize their companion. Whether they stay local or travel to another city, they'll easily be able to find other dogs nearby!

Thanks to cool stuff like websockets, users can chat between friends and mutual connections!

projects.title: OER4CTE
projects.description:
A website developed and launched with WordPress with plugins such as Yoast SEO to improve search engine optimization and Askimet Anti-Spam for security.


The site is optimized to be ADA friendly, as it was built for Livable Wage Jobs 501(c)(3) advocates for and builds pathways and projects that support youth governance and underrepresented student and learner access to high-wage, high-growth careers.

projects.title: BEAP Collection
projects.description:
Featuring a sleek and responsive design, this custom application designed for a premier automotive gallery provides an intuitive way for the owner to track his cars. 

Along with the client facing UI, this application features a CMS system where the collection's curator can edit various elements of the website on the fly, even through their mobile device. 

I currently run DevOps for the application through AWS and their services.

projects.title: Impactis
projects.description: During my internship with Impactis Global, an education startup based in India, I served as a Web Developer helping build a scalable platform that connects students with personalized, sponsor-funded scholarships. I led a small team of two developers, delegated tasks, and maintained the companys Git repository. My work focused on React-based front-end development, UI/UX optimization, payment gateway integration, and SEO strategy to improve visibility and conversion rates. I also contributed to the backend using Firebase and PostgreSQL, optimizing API communication and deployment pipelines via Vercel. This role strengthened my skills in full-stack development, CI/CD, and cross-functional teamwork within a fast-paced startup environment.
